sentences.sContent: These Texas maples are far enough south that they peak much later than many other deciduous trees in the United States.
sentences.sContent_eng: These Texas maples are far enough south that they peak much later than many other deciduous trees in the United States.
sentences.sCn: 这些德克萨斯州枫树是在足够远的南部，它们的憔悴期迟于美国的许多其他地方的落叶乔木。

synos.tran: [植]落叶性的，脱落性的；非永久性的

remMethod.val: de(向下) + cid(落下) + uous → 落叶的

trans.tranCn: 落叶的； 非永久的， 短暂的
trans.tranOther: deciduous trees lose their leaves in winter
